marketNews.title: Danantara Prepares IDR 210 Trillion Credit Ceiling for Village Cooperatives (KDMP)
marketNews.content:
Deputy Minister of Cooperatives, Farida Farichah said that Danantara has agreed to provide a credit ceiling of IDR 210 trillion for the development of approximately 80,000 Village Cooperatives (KDMP). Farida explained that Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) will each manage IDR 66 trillion, while the remaining IDR 12 trillion will be placed at Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). The table above shows the comparison of this ceiling with the current credit and third-party funds of the state-owned banks (Himbara). Danantara has not commented on Farida’s statement, so the source of the funds for the ceiling is not yet clear. Earlier, Minister of Cooperatives Ferry Juliantono in early October 2025 said that Danantara and the Ministry of Finance would channel additional funds to KDMP to accelerate physical construction and the operational needs of stores and warehouses. Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani said the Ministry of Finance support would be disbursed through the state budget, while the Director-General of the Ministry of Finance, Askolani, said the allocation could be taken from the inter-governmental transfer budget or other spending items. In the 2026 State Budget and Financial Statement, it is noted that the KDMP program will receive IDR 83 trillion from the state budget, to be channeled through Himbara.

To date, financing for KDMP that has been executed also involves Himbara, covering: 1) placement of the surplus budget (SAL) from the 2025 state budget amounting to IDR 16 trillion, with the related regulation enacted in early September 2025; and 2) a liquidity injection of IDR 200 trillion in early September 2025, which includes an interest-rate reduction incentive from about 3.8% to 2% if the funds are used for KDMP credit.

The latest development follows a delay in the programme’s implementation timeline. The latest update shows the government targets the physical infrastructure for about 80,000 KDMP to be completed and operational by March 2026, delayed from the original target of this month. As of Tuesday (28/10), only 22,351 KDMP are reported as active, representing 28% of the government target. Meanwhile, 82,246 KDMP have legal status, with 16,485 cooperatives already having stores.

marketNews.title: BEI Targets Higher Daily Transaction Value and IPO Count for 2026
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) targets the average daily transaction value (RNTH) in 2026 to reach IDR 14.5 trillion, 7.4% higher than the 2025 target of IDR 13.5 trillion. The IDX reported that the RNTH from the start of the year through 24 October 2025 reached IDR 16.46 trillion, up 28.1% year-to-date from the end-2024 level of IDR 12.85 trillion. Regarding new listings, the IDX aims for 50 IPOs in 2026, up from the revised 2025 target of 45 IPOs. Of the 2026 target, six IPOs are expected to be “lighthouse” offerings.

marketNews.title: US Announces Zero-Percent Tariffs on Selected Commodities from Malaysia, Cambodia and Thailand
marketNews.content: President Donald Trump granted a 0% import tariff for a range of commodities including palm oil, coffee, cocoa, and rubber from Malaysia, Cambodia, and Thailand, while export tariffs for other goods from those three countries remain at 19%. The agreement was signed at the ASEAN summit in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, last weekend. The United States also signed agreements with Malaysia and Thailand to strengthen cooperation in the critical mineral supply chain.

marketNews.title: Finance Minister Purbaya Vows to Avoid Burden-Sharing with Bank Indonesia
marketNews.content: Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa said on Tuesday (28/10) that he will try to avoid burden-sharing with Bank Indonesia for covering government programme costs, aiming to preserve the central bank’s autonomy. Bloomberg reported that the statement could reassure investors who have been worried about a new burden-sharing policy that could place Bank Indonesia under pressure to support economic growth. Earlier, Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo said in September 2025 that the central bank would purchase government bonds in the secondary market and bear part of the interest cost to help finance President Prabowo Subianto’s priority programmes in housing and village cooperatives.

marketNews.title: Government Considers DMO for Palm Oil to Support B50 Biodiesel Blend
marketNews.content: Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia said on Tuesday (28/10) that the government is considering the implementation of a domestic market obligation (DMO) on palm oil for a 50% biodiesel blend (B50). The DMO is one of three options being considered to balance palm-oil exports with domestic demand, the other two options being increased production or expanded plantations.

marketNews.title: CUAN Purchases ~1.5 Million PTRO Shares at IDR 6,538
marketNews.content: The subsidiary of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN) and the controlling shareholder of Petrosea (PTRO), PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, purchased approximately 1.5 million PTRO shares at an average price of IDR 6,538 per share on 28 October 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 10 billion. After the transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada’s ownership in PTRO increased from 45.313% to 45.328%.

marketNews.title: HRTA Signs Gold Supply Agreement with Bank Muamalat
marketNews.content: Hartadinata Abadi (HRTA) signed a cooperation agreement with Bank Muamalat for the supply and delivery of gold to customers, covering the purchase of 99.99% purity Emasku gold bars. HRTA said the cooperation is expected to strengthen the company’s position in the precious-metal market and boost operational performance.

marketNews.title: TBIG Transfers All Treasury Shares to Controlling Shareholder
marketNews.content: Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBIG) announced that the company transferred all treasury shares representing about 1.5% of total shares to its controlling shareholder, Bersama Digital Infrastructure Asia Pte. Ltd. The transaction was executed at IDR 2,138 per share, amounting to roughly IDR 749 billion, about 14.9% above the TBIG share price on Wednesday (29/10).

marketNews.title: KKGI Appointed as Project Initiator for Bener Mini-Hydro Plant
marketNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia (KKGI) announced that the Ministry of Public Works has appointed the company as the project initiator for the Bener mini-hydro power plant in Purworejo, Central Java. The project, valued at IDR 96 billion, will generate 6-10 MW of electricity, with plans to sell the power to the state utility in Central Java. KKGI said the feasibility study is complete and the project is awaiting Ministry of Public Works approval. KKGI also noted that it has a right-to-match in the upcoming tender.

marketNews.title: IMPC Director-General Purchases 3 Million Shares
marketNews.content: Impack Pratama Industri (IMPC) director-general Haryanto Tjiptodihardjo bought 3 million IMPC shares at an average price of IDR 2,273 per share on 28 October 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 6.8 billion. After the transaction, Haryanto’s direct ownership rose from 1.13% to 1.14%.

marketNews.title: BUAH Announces Interim Dividend for FY 2025
marketNews.content: Segar Kumala Indonesia (BUAH) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 of IDR 25 billion or IDR 12.5 per share, indicating a dividend yield of roughly 1.7% as of Wednesday (29/10). The dividend is payable on 28 November 2025, with the ex-date on 6 November 2025.

tickerNews.title: Danantara Credit Ceiling Announcement Involving BBNI, BMRI, BBRI, BRIS
tickerNews.content: Deputy Minister of Cooperatives Farida Farichah said Danantara has agreed to provide a credit ceiling of IDR 210 trillion for the development of about 80,000 Village Cooperatives (KDMP). Farida explained that Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) will each manage IDR 66 trillion, while the remaining IDR 12 trillion will be placed at Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS).

tickerNews.title: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Q3 2025 Results
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia reported adjusted EBITDA of IDR 516 billion in 3Q25 (+21% QoQ, +239% YoY), bringing 9-month adjusted EBITDA to IDR 1.3 trillion (vs. 9M24: negative IDR 79 billion). The operating improvement led to a net loss of IDR 255 billion in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25 loss of IDR 375 billion, 3Q24 loss of IDR 1.7 trillion). Revenue rose to IDR 4.7 trillion (+9% QoQ, +21% YoY). Management raised the 2025 adjusted EBITDA guidance to IDR 1.8-1.9 trillion from the prior range of IDR 1.4-1.6 trillion.

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak Q3 2025 Results
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak reported adjusted EBITDA of negative IDR 18 billion in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25 negative IDR 14 billion, 3Q24 negative IDR 168 billion), resulting in 9-month adjusted EBITDA of negative IDR 53 billion (vs. 9M24 negative IDR 193 billion). Net profit was IDR 2.4 trillion in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25 IDR 355 billion, 3Q24 IDR 155 billion), mainly due to a rise in investment gains of IDR 2.1 trillion. Revenue was flat quarter-on-quarter at IDR 1.6 trillion (+1% QoQ, +66% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources Minerals 3Q25 Results
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals reported net profit of US$15 million in 3Q25 (+76% QoQ, +123% YoY), taking 9-month net profit to US$ 38 million (+142% YoY), in line with about 75% of the 2025 consensus. The quarterly profit decline was driven by a 13% QoQ drop in operating profit despite a 9% QoQ revenue increase, as operating costs rose 48% QoQ (+25% YoY) versus revenue growth of 9% QoQ (+33% YoY). Gold sales were 17,559 oz in 3Q25 (+3% QoQ, –6% YoY) at an average price of US$3,402 per oz (+2% QoQ, +34% YoY). 9-month gold sales reached 56,552 oz (+25% YoY), 80-83% of the 2025 target, with an average price of US$3,156 per oz (+34% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Vale Indonesia 3Q25 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Vale Indonesia reported net profit of US$27 million in 3Q25 (+688% QoQ, +97% YoY), bringing 9-month net profit to US$52 million (+3% YoY), about 61% of the 2025 consensus. Operating profit in 3Q25 was US$33 million (vs. 2Q25 US$0.4 million, 3Q24 US$7 million) driven by a 27% QoQ increase in nickel ore revenue (US$39 million vs. 2Q25 US$2 million, 3Q24 none). Nickel matte sales were 19,557 ton (+9% QoQ, +10% YoY) at an average price of US$12,272 per ton (+1% QoQ, –5% YoY). Saprolite ore sales were 749 thousand ton in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25 67 thousand ton, 3Q24 none). 9-month nickel-matte volume was 54,676 ton (+2% YoY) at US$12,106 per ton (-9% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah 3Q25 Results
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah reported net profit of IDR 683 billion in 3Q25 (+129% YoY, +43% QoQ). The 9-month net profit was IDR 1.85 trillion (-8% YoY), about 63% of the 2025 consensus (vs. 9M24 67% of 2024). The profit recovery was driven by a 17% YoY and 23% QoQ rise in operating profit, improved gross-margin by 80-90 bps YoY and QoQ, and a moderate OPEX increase (-5% YoY, +23% QoQ). Currency gain of IDR 73 billion turned the 3Q25 result from a loss of  -  … (text truncated)

tickerNews.title: Indosat Q3 2025 Net Profit
tickerNews.content: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (ISAT) posted a net profit of IDR 1.2 trillion in 3Q25 (+10% YoY, +22% QoQ). The 9-month net profit was IDR 3.5 trillion (-7% YoY), about 73% of the 2025 consensus. Operating profit fell 11% YoY due to a 2% YoY revenue decline and a 4% YoY increase in cost of goods sold, although 3Q25 saw a 2% YoY and 4% QoQ rise in ARPU, reaching IDR 40 k per user, a record high for 2025. Operating margin on a quarterly basis rose to 18.4% (vs. 2Q25  ?? 17.7% and 3Q4 19.6 % ).

tickerNews.title: Bank Jago (ARTO) Result
tickerNews.content:
Bank Jago (Bank Jago) recorded a net profit of IDR 72 billion in 3Q25 (+100% YoY + 8% QoQ).
